Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2009 08:00PM arbojenn wrote: Thank you kira and binney! Binney, you have an amazing memory!  I start my rads October 12.  I had my reconstructed breast removed--and the other side, too--due to recurrent BC.  No lymphedema with the original, but this time I have already been told by the rad onc that I have moderate LE and can't expect it worsen.  I will ask about the lymphedema specialist when I go in for my SIMS on Thursday. Thanks again!

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2009 11:41PM arbojenn wrote: OH I am so sorry you are going through all this!  The hardest part is waiting.  I would, however, call the doctor first thing tomorrow and tell him about the nipple discharge.  He might be able to give you other causes which might help you hold on to hope as you wait or maybe move your biopsy up, especially if you emphasize the anxiety this is causing you.  Please let me know how it goes.  I am praying for you.

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2009 11:00AM arbojenn wrote: The biopsy will tell if it the mass was malignant or not.  Most surgeons do not venture an opinion until the biopsy results are back, so maybe that is a good sign.  When are you expected the biospy results?  Waiting is the most difficult part of this journey.  We "hurry up" and wait!
